sub_topic: Probability of a certain weather event occurring
message_1: Assuming that the probability of a certain city having rain on a given day is 0.3, find the probability that the city will not have rain on the next two consecutive days.
message_2:
The probability of the city not having rain on a given day is 1 - 0.3 = 0.7.

Since we want to find the probability of the city not having rain on two consecutive days, we can multiply the probabilities of not having rain on each day.

Probability (no rain on two consecutive days) = Probability (no rain on day 1) * Probability (no rain on day 2)

= 0.7 * 0.7 = 0.49

So, the probability of the city not having rain on the next two consecutive days is 0.49 or 49%.
